012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import java.sql.Connection;
015import static java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection;
016import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
017import java.sql.SQLException;
018import java.sql.Statement;
019
020import java.util.ArrayList;
021import java.util.Arrays;
022import java.util.Iterator;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Optional;
025
026import java.util.logging.Logger;
027import java.util.logging.Level;
028import static java.util.logging.Level.INFO;
029import static java.util.logging.Level.WARNING;
030
031import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
032import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
033
034import org.postgresql.pljava.Adapter.As;
035import org.postgresql.pljava.TargetList.Cursor;
036import org.postgresql.pljava.TargetList.Projection;
037
038import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
039import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
040
041import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject;
042import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject.Addressed;
043import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject.Named;
044import org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal;
045import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.ALL;
046import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.Direction.FORWARD;
047import org.postgresql.pljava.model.ProceduralLanguage;
048import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegClass;
049import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegClass.Known;
050import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegProcedure;
051import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegType;
052import org.postgresql.pljava.model.SlotTester;
053import org.postgresql.pljava.model.TupleTableSlot;
054
055/**
056 * A test that PL/Java's various {@link CatalogObject} implementations are
057 * usable.
058 *<p>
059 * They rely on named attributes, in PostgreSQL's system catalogs, that are
060 * looked up at class initialization, so on a PostgreSQL version that may not
061 * supply all the expected attributes, the issue may not be detected until
062 * an affected {@code CatalogObject} subclass is first used. This test uses as
063 * many of them as it can.
064 */
065@SQLAction(requires="catalogClasses function", install=
066    "SELECT javatest.catalogClasses()"
067)
068@SQLAction(requires="catalogInval function", install=
069    "SELECT javatest.catalogInval()"
070)
071public class CatalogObjects {
072    static final Logger logr = Logger.getAnonymousLogger();
073
074    static void log(Level v, String m, Object... p)
075    {
076        logr.log(v, m, p);
077    }
078
079    static final As<CatalogObject     ,?> CatObjAdapter;
080    static final As<ProceduralLanguage,?> PrLangAdapter;
081    static final As<RegClass          ,?> RegClsAdapter;
082    static final As<RegProcedure<?>   ,?> RegPrcAdapter;
083    static final As<RegType           ,?> RegTypAdapter;
084
085    static
086    {
087        try
088        {
089            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
090
091            // Get access to the hacked-together interim testing API
092            SlotTester t = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
093
094            String cls = "org.postgresql.pljava.pg.adt.OidAdapter";
095
096                    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") Object _1 =
097            CatObjAdapter =
098                (As<CatalogObject,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "INSTANCE");
099                    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") Object _2 =
100            PrLangAdapter =
101                (As<ProceduralLanguage,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls,"PLANG_INSTANCE");
102            RegClsAdapter =
103                (As<RegClass,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "REGCLASS_INSTANCE");
104            RegPrcAdapter =
105                (As<RegProcedure<?>,?>)t.adapterPlease(
106                    cls, "REGPROCEDURE_INSTANCE");
107            RegTypAdapter =
108                (As<RegType,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "REGTYPE_INSTANCE");
109        }
110        catch ( SQLException | ReflectiveOperationException e )
111        {
112            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError(e);
113        }
114    }
115
116    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="catalogInval function")
117    public static void catalogInval() throws SQLException
118    {
119        try (
120            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
121            Statement s = conn.createStatement();
122        )
123        {
124            SlotTester st = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
125            CatalogObject catObj;
126            String description1;
127            String description2;
128            boolean passing = true;
129
130            s.executeUpdate("CREATE TABLE tbl_a ()");
131            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegClsAdapter,
132                "SELECT CAST ('tbl_a' AS pg_catalog.regclass)");
133            description1 = catObj.toString();
134            s.executeUpdate("ALTER TABLE tbl_a RENAME TO tbl_b");
135            description2 = catObj.toString();
136            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("tbl_a", "tbl_b")) )
137            {
138                log(WARNING, "RegClass before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
139                    description1, description2);
140                passing = false;
141            }
142            s.executeUpdate("DROP TABLE tbl_b");
143            description1 = catObj.toString();
144            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
145            {
146                log(WARNING, "RegClass before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
147                    description1, description2);
148                passing = false;
149            }
150
151            s.executeQuery(
152                "SELECT sqlj.alias_java_language('lng_a', sandboxed => true)")
153                .next();
154            catObj = findObj(s, st, PrLangAdapter,
155                "SELECT oid FROM pg_catalog.pg_language " +
156                "WHERE lanname OPERATOR(pg_catalog.=) 'lng_a'");
157            description1 = catObj.toString();
158            s.executeUpdate("ALTER LANGUAGE lng_a RENAME TO lng_b");
159            description2 = catObj.toString();
160            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("lng_a", "lng_b")) )
161            {
162                log(WARNING,
163                    "ProceduralLanguage before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
164                    description1, description2);
165                passing = false;
166            }
167            s.executeUpdate("DROP LANGUAGE lng_b");
168            description1 = catObj.toString();
169            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
170            {
171                log(WARNING, "ProceduralLanguage before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
172                    description1, description2);
173                passing = false;
174            }
175
176            s.executeUpdate(
177                "CREATE FUNCTION fn_a() RETURNS INTEGER LANGUAGE SQL " +
178                "AS 'SELECT 1'");
179            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegPrcAdapter,
180                "SELECT CAST ('fn_a()' AS pg_catalog.regprocedure)");
181            description1 = catObj.toString();
182            s.executeUpdate("ALTER FUNCTION fn_a RENAME TO fn_b");
183            description2 = catObj.toString();
184            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("fn_a", "fn_b")) )
185            {
186                log(WARNING, "RegProcedure before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
187                    description1, description2);
188                passing = false;
189            }
190            s.executeUpdate("DROP FUNCTION fn_b");
191            description1 = catObj.toString();
192            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
193            {
194                log(WARNING, "RegProcedure before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
195                    description1, description2);
196                passing = false;
197            }
198
199            s.executeUpdate("CREATE TYPE typ_a AS ()");
200            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegTypAdapter,
201                "SELECT CAST ('typ_a' AS pg_catalog.regtype)");
202            description1 = catObj.toString();
203            s.executeUpdate("ALTER TYPE typ_a RENAME TO typ_b");
204            description2 = catObj.toString();
205            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("typ_a", "typ_b")) )
206            {
207                log(WARNING, "RegType before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
208                    description1, description2);
209                passing = false;
210            }
211            s.executeUpdate("DROP TYPE typ_b");
212            description1 = catObj.toString();
213            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
214            {
215                log(WARNING, "RegType before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
216                    description1, description2);
217                passing = false;
218            }
219
220            if ( passing )
221                log(INFO, "selective invalidation ok");
222        }
223    }
224
225    private static <T extends CatalogObject.Addressed<T>> T findObj(
226        Statement s, SlotTester st, As<? extends T,?> adapter, String query)
227    throws SQLException
228    {
229        try (
230            Portal p = st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(query))
231        )
232        {
233            return
234                p.tupleDescriptor().applyOver(p.fetch(FORWARD, 1), c0 -> c0
235                    .stream()
236                    .map(c -> c.apply(adapter, o -> o))
237                    .findFirst().get());
238        }
239    }
240
241    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="catalogClasses function")
242    public static void catalogClasses() throws SQLException
243    {
244        String catalogRelationsQuery =
245            "SELECT" +
246            "  oid" +
247            " FROM" +
248            "  pg_catalog.pg_class" +
249            " WHERE" +
250            "   relnamespace = CAST ('pg_catalog' AS pg_catalog.regnamespace)" +
251            "  AND" +
252            "   relkind = 'r'";
253
254        try (
255            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
256            Statement s = conn.createStatement();
257        )
258        {
259            SlotTester st = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
260
261            List<Known> knownRegClasses;
262
263            try (
264                Portal p =
265                    st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(catalogRelationsQuery))
266            )
267            {
268                Projection proj = p.tupleDescriptor();
269                List<TupleTableSlot> tups = p.fetch(FORWARD, ALL);
270
271                Class<Known> knownCls = Known.class;
272
273                knownRegClasses =
274                    proj.applyOver(tups, c0 -> c0.stream()
275                        .map(c -> c.apply(RegClsAdapter, regcls -> regcls))
276                        .filter(knownCls::isInstance)
277                        .map(knownCls::cast)
278                        .collect(toList())
279                    );
280            }
281
282            int passed = 0;
283            int untested = 0;
284
285            for ( Known regc : knownRegClasses )
286            {
287                String objectQuery =
288                    "SELECT oid FROM " + regc.qualifiedName() + " LIMIT 1";
289
290                Class<? extends Addressed> classUnderTest = null;
291
292                try (
293                    Portal p =
294                        st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(objectQuery))
295                )
296                {
297                    Projection proj = p.tupleDescriptor();
298                    List<TupleTableSlot> tups = p.fetch(FORWARD, ALL);
299                    Optional<CatalogObject> cobj =
300                        proj.applyOver(tups, c0 -> c0.stream()
301                            .map(c -> c.apply(CatObjAdapter, o -> o))
302                            .findAny());
303
304                    if ( ! cobj.isPresent() )
305                    {
306                        log(INFO,
307                            "database has no {0} objects " +
308                            " for representation test", regc.name());
309                        ++ untested;
310                        continue;
311                    }
312
313                    Addressed aobj = cobj.get().of(regc);
314
315                    classUnderTest = aobj.getClass();
316
317                    if ( aobj instanceof Named )
318                    {
319                        ((Named)aobj).name();
320                        ++ passed;
321                        continue;
322                    }
323
324                    log(INFO,
325                        "{0} untested, not instance of Named " +
326                        "(does implement {1})",
327                        classUnderTest.getCanonicalName().substring(
328                            1 + classUnderTest.getPackageName().length()),
329                        Arrays.stream(classUnderTest.getInterfaces())
330                            .map(Class::getSimpleName)
331                            .collect(joining(", "))
332                    );
333                }
334                catch ( LinkageError e )
335                {
336                    Throwable t = e.getCause();
337                    if ( null == t )
338                        t = e;
339                    log(WARNING,
340                        "{0} failed initialization: {1}",
341                        classUnderTest.getName().substring(
342                            1 + classUnderTest.getPackageName().length()),
343                        t.getMessage());
344                }
345            }
346
347            log((knownRegClasses.size() == passed + untested)? INFO : WARNING,
348                "of {0} catalog representations, {1} worked " +
349                "and {2} could not be tested",
350                knownRegClasses.size(), passed, untested);
351        }
352    }
353}
